results.title: Coronary vascular reactivity and calcium antagonist therapy in patients with angina.
results.text_hl: The coronary vascular responses to the cold pressor test and the diving reflex were unchanged with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@. However, the smoking-induced increase in @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Aneurysm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003323 @@@coronary vascular resistance@@@ was significantly attenuated after @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (+3.2 +/- 2.7% vs. +16.8 +/- 7.2%; p < 0.05).

citations.NLM: Perondi R, Saino A, Zanchetti A, Mancia G. Coronary vascular reactivity and calcium antagonist therapy in patients with angina. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1994;24 Suppl A():S30-6. PMID: 7603075
citations.BibTeX: @article{7603075, title={Coronary vascular reactivity and calcium antagonist therapy in patients with angina.}, author={Perondi R and Saino A and Zanchetti A and Mancia G}, journal={J Cardiovasc Pharmacol}, volume={24 Suppl A}, pages={S30-6}}

results.title: Effects of amlodipine on coronary hemodynamics and vascular responses to sympathetic stimulation in patients with coronary heart disease.
results.text_hl: The drug did not modify responses to CPT and diving or pressure and HR responses to smoking, whereas the smoking-induced increase in @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Aneurysm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003323 @@@coronary vascular resistance@@@ was attenuated after @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ administration (+3.2 +/- 2.7%, p < 0.05 vs. control condition).

citations.NLM: Saino A, Pomidossi G, Perondi R, Gregorini L, Rimini A, Alessio P, Zanchetti A, Mancia G. Effects of amlodipine on coronary hemodynamics and vascular responses to sympathetic stimulation in patients with coronary heart disease. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1994 Dec;24(6):875-82. PMID: 7898068
citations.BibTeX: @article{7898068, title={Effects of amlodipine on coronary hemodynamics and vascular responses to sympathetic stimulation in patients with coronary heart disease.}, author={Saino A and Pomidossi G and Perondi R and Gregorini L and Rimini A and Alessio P and Zanchetti A and Mancia G}, journal={J Cardiovasc Pharmacol}, volume={24}, number={6}, pages={875-82}}

results.title: An updated meta-analysis of calcium-channel blockers in the prevention of restenosis after coronary angioplasty.
results.text_hl: Recently, the results of 2 large similar trials (@CHEMICAL_Nisoldipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015737 @@@Nisoldipine@@@ In @DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@Coronary Artery Disease@@@ in Leuven [NICOLE], and @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Aneurysm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003323 @@@Coronary AngioPlasty@@@ @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ in @DISEASE_Coronary_Restenosis @DISEASE_MESH:D023903 @@@REstenosis@@@ Study [CAPARES]) were published.

citations.NLM: Dens J, Desmet W, Piessens J. An updated meta-analysis of calcium-channel blockers in the prevention of restenosis after coronary angioplasty. Am Heart J. 2003 Mar;145(3):404-8. PMID: 12660661
citations.BibTeX: @article{12660661, title={An updated meta-analysis of calcium-channel blockers in the prevention of restenosis after coronary angioplasty.}, author={Dens J and Desmet W and Piessens J}, journal={Am Heart J}, volume={145}, number={3}, pages={404-8}}

results.title: Azelnidipine and amlodipine anti-coronary atherosclerosis trial in hypertensive patients undergoing coronary intervention by serial volumetric intravascular ultrasound analysis in Juntendo University (ALPS-J).
results.text_hl: BACKGROUND: A previous study reported that @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ retarded @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Aneurysm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003323 @@@coronary plaque@@@ progression in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery disease@@@.

citations.NLM: Kojima T, Miyauchi K, Yokoyama T, Yokoyama K, Kurata T, Suwa S, Kawamura M, Tamura H, Okazaki S, Inoue K, Fujiwara Y, Sumiyoshi M, Tanimoto K, Nakazato Y, Yamagami S, Hiro T, Komiyama N, Daida H. Azelnidipine and amlodipine anti-coronary atherosclerosis trial in hypertensive patients undergoing coronary intervention by serial volumetric intravascular ultrasound analysis in Juntendo University (ALPS-J). Circ J. 2011;75(5):1071-9. PMID: 21471671

results.title: Ambulatory blood pressure monitoring predicts cardiovascular events in treated hypertensive patients--an Anglo-Scandinavian cardiac outcomes trial substudy.
results.text_hl: BACKGROUND: Results of the Anglo-Scandinavian cardiac outcomes trial-blood pressure lowering arm (ASCOT-BPLA) showed significantly lower rates of @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Aneurysm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003323 @@@coronary and stroke@@@ events in individuals allocated an @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@-@CHEMICAL_Perindopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020913 @@@perindopril@@@ combination drug regimen than in those allocated an @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@-@CHEMICAL_Thiazides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D049971 @@@thiazide@@@ combination drug regimen.

citations.NLM: Dolan E, Stanton AV, Thom S, Caulfield M, Atkins N, McInnes G, Collier D, Dicker P, O'Brien E, ASCOT Investigators. Ambulatory blood pressure monitoring predicts cardiovascular events in treated hypertensive patients--an Anglo-Scandinavian cardiac outcomes trial substudy. J Hypertens. 2009 Apr;27(4):876-85. PMID: 19516185
citations.BibTeX: @article{19516185, title={Ambulatory blood pressure monitoring predicts cardiovascular events in treated hypertensive patients--an Anglo-Scandinavian cardiac outcomes trial substudy.}, author={Dolan E and Stanton AV and Thom S and Caulfield M and Atkins N and McInnes G and Collier D and Dicker P and O'Brien E and ASCOT Investigators}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={27}, number={4}, pages={876-85}}

results.title: Role of blood pressure and other variables in the differential cardiovascular event rates noted in the Anglo-Scandinavian Cardiac Outcomes Trial-Blood Pressure Lowering Arm (ASCOT-BPLA).
results.text_hl: BACKGROUND: Results of the Anglo-Scandinavian Cardiac Outcomes Trial-Blood Pressure Lowering Arm (ASCOT-BPLA) show significantly lower rates of @<m>DISEASE_Coronary_Aneurysm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003323 @@@coronary and stroke@@@ events in individuals allocated an @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@-based combination drug regimen than in those allocated an @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@-based combination drug regimen (HR 0.86 and 0.77, respectively).

citations.NLM: Poulter NR, Wedel H, Dahlöf B, Sever PS, Beevers DG, Caulfield M, Kjeldsen SE, Kristinsson A, McInnes GT, Mehlsen J, Nieminen M, O'Brien E, Ostergren J, Pocock S, ASCOT Investigators. Role of blood pressure and other variables in the differential cardiovascular event rates noted in the Anglo-Scandinavian Cardiac Outcomes Trial-Blood Pressure Lowering Arm (ASCOT-BPLA). Lancet. 2005 Sep 10-16;366(9489):907-13. PMID: 16154017
citations.BibTeX: @article{16154017, title={Role of blood pressure and other variables in the differential cardiovascular event rates noted in the Anglo-Scandinavian Cardiac Outcomes Trial-Blood Pressure Lowering Arm (ASCOT-BPLA).}, author={Poulter NR and Wedel H and Dahlöf B and Sever PS and Beevers DG and Caulfield M and Kjeldsen SE and Kristinsson A and McInnes GT and Mehlsen J and Nieminen M and O'Brien E and Ostergren J and Pocock S and ASCOT Investigators}, journal={Lancet}, volume={366}, number={9489}, pages={907-13}}
